net.sf.freecol.common.i18n

Class Messages

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.freecol.common.i18n.Messages

  • public class Messages
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a collection of messages in a particular locale. The individual messages are read from property files in the data/strings directory. The property files are called "FreeColMessages[_LANGUAGE[_COUNTRY[_VARIANT]]].properties", where LANGUAGE should be an ISO 639-2 or ISO 639-3 language code, COUNTRY should be an ISO 3166-2 country code, and VARIANT is an arbitrary string. The encoding of the property files is UTF-8. Since the Java Properties class is unable to handle UTF-8 directly, this class uses its own implementation. The individual messages may include variables, which must be delimited by percent characters (e.g. "%nation%"), and will be replaced when the message is formatted. Furthermore, the messages may include choice formats consisting of a tag followed by a colon (":"), a selector and one or several choices separated from the selector and each other by pipe characters ("|"). The entire choice format must be enclosed in double brackets ("{{" and "}}", respectively). Each choice must consist of a key and a value separated by an equals character ("="), unless it is a variable, in which case the variable must resolve to another choice format. The selector may also be a variable. If the selector is omitted, then one of the choices should use the key "default". Choice formats may be nested. 
       key1=%colony% tuottaa tuotetta {{tag:acc|%goods%}}.
   key2={{plural:%amount%|one=ruoka|other=ruokaa|default={{tag:|acc=viljaa|default=Vilja}}}}
   key3={{tag:|acc=viljaa|default={{plural:%amount%|one=ruoka|other=ruokaa|default=Ruoka}}}}
    This class is NOT thread-safe. (CO: I cannot find any place that really has a problem)

      • loadMessageBundle

        public static void loadMessageBundle(java.util.Locale locale)
        Load the message bundle for the given locale Error messages have to go to System.err as this routine is called before logging is enabled.
        Parameters:
        locale - The Locale to set resources for.

      • loadMessages

        public static void loadMessages(java.io.InputStream is)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Loads messages from a resource file into the current message bundle. Public for the test suite.
        Parameters:
        is - The InputStream to read from.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - on failure to read from the stream.

      • loadModMessageBundle

        public static void loadModMessageBundle(java.util.Locale locale)
        Load localized messages for all mods. We can not initially load resources from mods because not all mods can be loaded until the user mod directory is initialized, which depends on the command line processing, which in turn requires at least the basic localized message resources to be loaded. So this routine is called separately when the mods are finally loaded.
        Parameters:
        locale - The Locale to load resources for.

      • loadActiveModMessageBundle

        public static void loadActiveModMessageBundle(java.util.List<FreeColModFile> mods,
                                              java.util.Locale locale)
        Load messages specific to active mods. Called when the spec is updated with the selected mods.
        Parameters:
        mods - The list of FreeColModFile for the active mods.
        locale - The Locale to load resources for.

      • getLocale

        public static java.util.Locale getLocale(java.lang.String languageID)
        Get the Locale corresponding to a given language name. Public as this is needed for language option processing and the initial locale setting.
        Parameters:
        languageID - An underscore separated language/country/variant tuple.
        Returns:
        The Locale for the specified language.

      • getKey

        public static java.lang.String getKey(java.lang.String preferredKey,
                                      java.lang.String defaultKey)
        Returns the preferred key if it is contained in the message bundle and the default key otherwise. This should be used to select the most specific message key available.
        Parameters:
        preferredKey - a String value
        defaultKey - a String value
        Returns:
        a String value

      • getBestNameAndDescription

        public static java.lang.String[] getBestNameAndDescription(Named named)
        Get the name and best description for a given named object. Favour the .name form, but degrade gracefully if it is not present. If .name is present, also look for a description.
        Parameters:
        named - The Named to look up.
        Returns:
        A 2-element array of name and description found.

      • getBestNameAndDescription

        public static java.lang.String[] getBestNameAndDescription(java.lang.String id)
        Get the name and best description for a given identifier. Favour the .name form, but degrade gracefully if it is not present. If .name is present, also look for a description.
        Parameters:
        id - The identifier to look up.
        Returns:
        A 2-element array of name and description found.

      • getUnitLabel

        public static StringTemplate getUnitLabel(java.lang.String name,
                                          java.lang.String typeId,
                                          int number,
                                          java.lang.String nationId,
                                          java.lang.String roleId,
                                          StringTemplate extra)
        Get a label for a collection of units given a name, type, number, nation, role and extra annotation.
        Parameters:
        name - An optional unit name.
        typeId - The unit type identifier.
        number - The number of units.
        nationId - An optional nation identifier.
        roleId - The unit role identifier.
        extra - An optional extra annotation.
        Returns:
        A StringTemplate to describe the given unit.

      • message

        public static java.lang.String message(java.lang.String messageId)
        Get the text mapping for a particular identifier in the default locale message bundle. Returns the key as the value if there is no mapping found!
        Parameters:
        messageId - The key of the message to find.
        Returns:
        String text mapping or the key
